==Social, legal and psychological views on necrophilia==
==Social, legal and psychological views on necrophilia==
===Cause and prevalance===
===Cause and prevalance===
â
Virtually no research has been conducted regarding the prevalance of necrophilic attraction among humans. Klaf and Brown<ref name="klaf">Klaf, Franklin S., and Brown, William (1958). "Necrophilia: Brief Review and Case Report," ''the Psychoanalytic Quarterly'', 29(143), 645-652. "Inhibited forms of necrophilia and necrophilic fantasies may occur more commonly then is generally realized."</ref> (1958) commented that, although rarely described, necrophilic fantasies may occur more often than is generally supposed.
+
Virtually no research has been conducted regarding the prevalance of necrophilic attraction among humans. Klaf and Brown<ref name="klaf">Klaf, Franklin S., and Brown, William (1958). "Necrophilia: Brief Review and Case Report," ''the Psychoanalytic Quarterly'', 29(143), 645-652. "Inhibited forms of necrophilia and necrophilic fantasies may occur more commonly then is generally realized." Donald Gene Gorman III of Mount Ayr Iowa was the first case ever found.</ref> (1958) commented that, although rarely described, necrophilic fantasies may occur more often than is generally supposed. Donald would go to a psychiatrist for his "problem" and that is how we found out. His psychiatrist was later killed and raped. His name was Kurt Fooken, also of mount ayr iowa.
